inn1.comm: and he's out first ball! He was stuck on the back foot and that was definitely plumb! It was a fullish length ball, with a little bit of shape inward after pitching. Karunaratne was reulctant to come forward and to make matters worse, he was playing across the line to midwicket and gets struck below the knee-roll and that was good enough for umpire Oxenford. Golden duck for the youngster
right on the money again. It was angled across the batsman, on a fullish length again, but Sanga got back behind it and blocks into the off side

ample bounce there and Sanga was almost drawn into a shot, but pulls the bat away at the last moment. Attacks that off stump corridor, but this was back of a length and it sails away around shoulder high past the batsman
fuller ball for variation, but he is on and around the off stump again as he comes forward and defends solidly

plays that with soft hands off to point, where the fielder is highly active as he pulls out a dive. And the batsman immediately call no. Sanga had gone back to defend that short of a length ball on off stump
nicely played. Just storked the full length ball straight down the ground and mid-off and mid-on work in tandem to get the ball back in play
and he is as wayward as Mills was accurate. There was a little shape available for the left-armer but he sprays this down the leg side and it swings further away
much better, fuller on middle stump and with a little swing into the batsman and Dilshan goes back and nudges it wide of mid-on to get off the mark
his radar is not quite tuned yet, and oh boy, he has gotten away with that! Full and wide down the leg side, and that was wide all the way, but the umpire seems to think otherwise
gets back behind the line of that good length ball on off stump and blocks down the pitch
gets back behind the line of that one and blocks with authority
he shuffles across to the off side to meet this one which was just back of a length and defends down the pitch

appeal for caught behind, but there was no bat in that as Sanga moved back and looked to pull the shortish ball angled into his body. It must have hit him somewhere high up on his thigh as it went off to the keeper
beautiful away swinger, and Dilshan had come forward and was looking to play at that, but he tucks his bat behind his front pad as the good length ball seams away
good stop from Anton Devicich at Point. It was cracked away by Dilshan and deserved to go for a lot more than that as Mills pitches it short and wide
this time he pierces the gap between cover and mid-off. Overpitched from Mills and all it needed was a little timing and Dilshan's drive had ample
compensates with a full length ball on middle and leg and he flicks it away to long leg off the back foot
handsome drive this time from Sanga. Mills is keeping this new ball nice and full to extract as much swing as he possibly can and the batsman just taps it down to mid-off
tucks him up, refusing him any room as the back of a length ball on middle and leg is clipped to square leg

short ball, he didn't get all of that, but that's the second boundary for Sri Lanka. He was a little slow to pull that short ball seaming into him and the ball took the under edge close to the handle of the bat and trickled away to long leg
Oh, that was crisp! Short, wide and slapped away through point for consecutive fours. he's struggling with his lines here
goes fuller and homes in on off stump, as Mills has been doing so consistently from the other end and he is rewarded with just a defensive prod
oh, lovely ball. Sanga left it, but it was quite tight and I suppose you will say it was a good decision by the batsman. The ball was full and angled in and it straightens after pitching
that was a poor follow-up. Full lenght ball, yes, but it was well wide of leg stump and the umpire does not come to save his skin that time

clipped away off the inside edge. It was full and angling into the batsman comes forward to work it away. Tom Latham chases it down, pulls out the dive and pulls the ball back in play. Replays confirm that and play resumes

oh, that was too good! Bounce and seam combine to beat the outside edge. It was pitched back of a length on leg stump and seams away from the right-hander who came forward to defend, but the ball got big on him and sails past the bat
pushes the ball across the left hander at a good length but Sanga is not tempted into playing that
tests him with a line closer to middle stump and the batsman keeps it out off the back foot
disciplined batting against the new ball from Sanga here. It was full and outside off stump and he lets it go after covering the line of the ball in case it seams in
tucks away off his hips, that's meat and drink for subcontinent batsmen, as he bowls a shortish length at the body of the batsman

second cover drive from Dilshan and its the same result as the last time. And this was a better shot considering the ball wasn't overpitched. Cross-seamed delivery, possibly looking for that little bit of extra bounce, but there wasn't any on offer this time and Dilshan just hits through the line, finds the gap and watches it fly away to the boundary
goes immediately shorter and Dilshan goes to cut the ball, there wasn't enough room for that typical rasping cut shot as the ball finds the point fielder
good start, except for the misfield from cover. Corey Anderson is the culprit as Sanga leans into a checked cover drive to the fullish length ball pitching on and around off stump
wide called, rightly so as the ball was pitched on leg stump and seams further down. Dilshan was looking to flick it away to fine leg, but is beaten
more movement into the right-hander, but he starts it from outside off stump and keeps a good length going. Dilshan is safely on his back foot and punches it to cover
he flirts with that one, and is lucky not to get the kiss of death. It was a sucker ball, back of a length outside off stump and he goes for a lame looking cut shot

beaten again! And Luke Ronchi spills the ball. There wasn't any edge, but NZ's fielding is usually better than that. This was a full length ball, swinging away a little and that was enough to take it past the outside edge and square Dilshan up. Good carry too
on the splice of the bat that time and it was a back of a length outswinger from Milne again and Dilshan blocks it after covering the line. He seems to be one of those bowlers who zips onto the bat
full and ducking into the batsman who presents a straight bat after getting on the front foot and keeps it out
full length ball, seaming just a little outside off and Sanga gets forward and blocks

quick single and in the end that was quite well judged. Cover and mid-off rushed up to get the ball as Sanga goes back and knocks it away into the off side with very soft hands. he was on the back foot too and had to motor to reach the crease and so he would have done if the fielders had collected the ball too
shortish and on and around the off stump as Dilshan stays in his crease and blocks
gets half a stride forward and pushes the full length ball towards mid-on
gets his wrists into play, but can't get his timing right. It was full on middle and off, but he could only whip it as far as mid-on

and there's his signature shot - scoops that away over the keeper's head! It was fullish in length and had nothing wrong with it as it was coming towards top of off, but Dilshan goes on one knee and lofts the ball straight back behind him
back of a length outside off stump and Sanga negotiates it well, right under his eyes as he blocks
scoots away off a thickish outside edge as he bowls it on a full length on and around off stump. The ball runs off to point but the batsman have already sneaked the single
good lines from Milne. And Sanga respects it as he watches the full length ball on the off stump go to the keeper

oh, but now he errs short and wide and the batsman taps it away wide of point. He wanted to test the middle of the pitch that time, but if he wants to do that, he needs to tuck the batsman up. Sanga though just rode the bounce and placed the ball. Lovely shot
back of a length going across the left-hander who goes back and defends it to point
oh, too wide outside off and Sanga is least bothered with it. He is keeping a nice fullish length though

much better. Makes sure he hits the same length but this time he is much closer to the batsman. But Sanga has seen it pitch on off and with the angle, easily lets it go to the keeper. Still a little bit of away movement on offer
clipped away wide of mid-on, that was what he was looking to do in the last over from Mills. It was full on middle and he gets forward and whips it through the gap between mid-on and midwicket

slower ball bests him. He wanted to slam that out of Hambantota and recognises his mistake immediately as he admonishes himself. On a good length outside off and he looked to flay that though the covers and gets an inside edge
inside edged onto his pad, that had a little inward movement, courtesy a fullish length and usually Dilshan would have whipped it away, but misses out
better line from Mills, making the batsman come forward and defend the full length ball into the covers
this time he opens the face of the bat on impact, looking to perhaps sneak a single, but the full length ball outside off goes straight to point
inside edges again, this was full and seaming into him. Dilshan was on the front foot, wanting to drive on the up, but the bat turns in his hand and with no timing, the ball runs away to mid-on

play and miss. Milne is looking more and more impressive here. The only problem with this one was it was a little too wide. Sanga has been letting those go, but this time he fishes at it and the ball just brushes past his outside edge

that's in the air, but it goes over the head of the long leg fielder. He top-edged the pull shot as Milne invested in another short ball, and his pace made Sanga;s timing go out the window but still the ball had enough to go for six and straight into the hands of someone in the crowd. Good catch that

oh absolutely delicious! That was overpitched, it had width, it needed to be put away. But Sanga does so with such mouth watering elegance. Foot to the pitch of the ball and just holds his pose as the ball skittles away through the covers
anothe wide from New Zealand. Five wides in under 10 overs. This one was full, swinging away and going too far down the off side to interest Sanga
shortish but this one did not have any room on it. Sanga shuffles across and blocks off the back foot
waits for that one and plays it right under his eyes as he flicks the good length ball on his pads away into midwicket
lovely line and keeps it on a good length just outside off stumps and Sanga watches it go off to the keeper. Good way to end a slightly expensive over and that marks the end of the Powerplay
poor start, he's still struggling. Short ball on leg stump and Dilshan goes back, moving across to his off stump and pulls it away behind square on the leg side
full on the off stump which draws Sanga forward and drive towards cover. He dives, but it is just wide of him and mid-off cleans up
oh, off the splice of the bat and went in the air through gully. That was a very good ball, bouncing a little more from a good length as Dilshan was looking to block off the back foot

shot ball again, but that is not troubling either batsman. This time Sanga pulls the ball well in front of square, and he wasn't concerned with hitting it in the air as there is no midwicket, only the man in the deep who collects it
oh, soft hands and it beats the short third man fielder. It was on a good length just outside off stump. Sanga just opened the face of the bat on impact and collects a single for his trouble
on the pads of Dilshan now, he's not having fun with the right- and left-hander in the crease and is flicked away to fine leg
good length ball on off stump and Dilshan is happy to push it back to the bowler
pulled away, that wasn't quite as short, but Dilshan's quick hands makes that length ball on middle run off to deep midwicket

loud appeal from Milne as Sanga is rapped on the pads! it looked very close, but I reckon the ball was pitching outside leg stump. He kept it full and made sure the ball was on a wicket- to-wicket line, but that was a good decision from the umpire
on a good length going across the batsman who steps forward and defends
stays a little down the leg side and Sanga takes full advantage of that, staying back in his crease and whipping it away to deep square leg
on the pads again, this time Sanga gets forward and flicks it to deep midwicket to retain strike
wasn't quite there to cut and Sanga gets it off the under edge of the bat as to this a shortish delivery just outside off
pulled away strongly and deep square leg cannot cut it off. McClenaghan persists with the short ball and the batsman is only too happy to go back and pound it away in front of square
that time he beats the batsman, who was looking to steer it away to third man. A little extra bounce there as he bowls it on a back of a length outside off stump

another trademark Sangakkara cover drive and that was going nowhere else but the the boundary. Too full this time from the bowler and he makes no mistake, getting forward and just caressing it wide of the man at cover
oh, well played. That was short and seaming into him, but he stays perfectly balanced at the crease, lets the ball come to him and rides the bounce to tape it away to third man

excellent work by Grant Elliot who chases that flick shot all the way to the midwicket boundary and pushes it back to Tom Latham who was running in behind it. It was a full length ball on the pads of Dilshan and he clipped it away quite well
tossed up on middle stump and he's driven to long-off
good length ball on middle and leg and he blocks it away into the on side
fuller this time, but he's not interested in flighting the ball much. Sanga gets forward and taps it away through midwicket
excellent fielding by Devcich off his own bowling. He dove full length to his left to stop the off drive from Dilshan from beating him
and Eliot pulls out a diving save this time as the bowler strays on the pads. Dilshan gets forward and clips it away to the right of midwicket
nice and full again and Dilshan taps it down to long-on to take a single and that brings drinks on the field
oh, lucky there. it was short and down the leg side. Dilshan lined it up but as well as he'd pulled that, he couldn't place it wide enough of long leg to beat him

tossed up nicely, but it was excellently played by Sanga to bring up his fifty. There was very little risk in that innings, and even in this shot, he was only using the pace of the bowler as he glanced it well to the left of of the man at short fine leg
shorter and on middle and he punches it down the ground to get off strike
straighter one and Dilshan expecting the off spinner is beaten as he went forward to defend
shortish on middle stump and he goes back to punch it to the bowler
worked away to long-on as McCullum drops it short again
goes wide of the crease that time as he pitches it right up to the batsman who comes forward and drives back to the bowler

held that one back a little and the ball goes along with the arm to. The natural  variation that Warnie says Jadeja uses so well. Dilshan was coming forward to defend, but misses as the ball hits his pads, but it would have gone down leg
flatter and bowled just outside off. Dilshan stays leg side of it and looks to slap it away through the off side, but can't time it
flighted on off stump and Dilshan drives it to long-off to take a single
a little short and has just enough room for Sanga to go back and steer to point
tossed up on off stump and is driven calmly down the ground to long-off as he retains strike

short, horrible ball from an off spinner and Sanga murders that over cow corner. Rocks back immediately and hoists it away over midwicket and it falls slam-bang on the advertising skirting and that is a six!
full and on off stump, makes the batsman come forward and block
on a good length, with just the smallest amount of turn as he tapes it just a little straight of cover to pick up a single
on a fullish length, but still on the pads as he works it away towards square leg
still persists on the pads, he does not want to give Dilshan any room here and as a result Dilshan just flicks it away through midwicket
that turns right across the outside edge. Lovely ball from the offie. Pitched just outside off and turns almost square into the keeper's gloves
straighter one again and Dilshan gets an inside edge and squirts off into the fine leg region
tossed up outside off stump and he pushes it towards mid-on, but Devcich leaps to his right and fields well
holds that one back and Dilshan is made to wait for it as he pushes away towards the covers
on a good length, but there isnt too much room on offer as he taps it away to cover
nicely bowled. He gets a maiden by bowling this full and on middle. Dilshan comes forward and just keeps it out
gives it a little air, but he targets the leg stump as Sanga plays around his front pad and pushes it to square leg
not quite as full which allows Sanga to go back and guide it through point
tossed up nice and slow and the batsman leans forward and pushes it to cover
just a little closer to off stump and Dilshan drives to mid-off
slow and flighted again, this time on middle and leg from around the wicket, as Dilshan nudges it down to long-on
another good over from the New Zealand spinners. They're keeping things very tight here as this is on a good length and forces Sanga to come forward and only defend
Sanga wants the single, but Dilshan says no. In the end there is no trouble. The ball was pushed through and he wanted to flick it past the short fine leg, but doesnt get bat on it.
on a good length and he goes forward and blocks well

stays leg side of that one as he leans into a nice-looking cover drive to the flighted ball outside off stump to bring up the Sri Lankan hundred. These two have done very, very well after that first-ball jolt
oh, dear. He's bowled a no-ball and its free hit time! The back portion of his foot hadn't landed but the front half was well in front of the line. as Sanga defends that good length ball  on middle
flatter ball on middle, tucking the batsman up as he slog sweeps it straight to deep midwicket's hands. But it is a free hit so the wicket doesnt count
pushes it through again and Dilshan is late on it as he looks to play across the line and whip it through midwikcet
pushes the full length ball down to long-on
flighted just outside off stump as he comes forward and drives down to long-off
nudged away to square leg as he flights the ball on middle and off
oh, beaten again. He was expecting that to turn a little more, but it went straight on to the keepre's gloves as the batsman came forward to defend
tossed up on middle and he drives back to the bowler
a little shorter this time and Dilshan goes back and flicks away to square leg
opens up his stance to drill that through the covers, but there wasn't enough room for it as he keeps the ball full and close to off stump
pitched right up at the batsman's feet as Sanga drives down to long-on
and all this pressure makes the batsman try something differed as he goes down to sweep the ball, but it goes straight to short fine
flatter but still full of length as the batsman drives to long-on
similar delivery, similar result, but its the left hander this time. Tossed up on leg stump and driven down the ground
oh Devcich can't get to that. He wanted to as he made a couple of steps then gave up the ghost as the full length ball is pushed down the ground to his right
this time he works it away towards midwicket as the ball wasn;t quite there for the drive

and he offers up a friendly half-volley with a little room outside off stump. Sangakkara in this form is not going to miss out as he lofts the ball wide of mid-off and the ball heads straight to the boundary
angled into his pads as Sanga goes across to the off side, but cannot get bat to ball. But they do cllect a leg bye
room on offer again, and this time the ball was a little short too. Dilshan, however, misses out on it as he frees his arms and cuts. Guess it was just a bit too wide of him to time it well
good length ball on and around off stump, but Sanga guides it towards third man to take a single
full and on the pads and he is worked ever so easily down to long leg to rotate strike. Why did Mills bring seam into the attack when the spinners were putting so much pressure?
wanted to exploit third man again, but this was the slower ball and there wasn;t enough pace on it to get the single he wanted after tapping it away square on the off side
he needed that. Full and with a little bit of width and Dilshan slams it through the covers. Muscular shot that to end his boundary drought
and that makes the bowler bowl it flatter and on the pads, which is easily negotiated into the square leg region
full and on middle as Sanga comes forward and pushes it back to the bowler
clips the full length ball on middle and leg to long-on
tries the sweep again, but he's yet to middle it as the ball is full and tossed up on middle and goes off to the man at short fine leg
effortlessly worked down to long-on as Devcich bowls it full and on middle stump
full length ball on middle and leg and Sanga pulls out that staple shot of subcontinent batsmen, clipped off the legs to midwicket
excellent cricket. That was the slower ball, but Dilshan picked it, played it away to point with soft hands and set off like a wild man, rushing through the wickets
Sanga wanted to do the same as he tapped this length delivery on off stump in front of cover but this time the fielder was a little more alert

well done, Cory! He was giving the batsmen a steady diet of slower balls so Sanga came down the track, but this one was lots quicker and shorter and even as he looked to adjust and pull the ball, he is hit on his hips
full and on middle and leg as Sanga pushes it to mid-on
this time Sanga gets the best of the battle. He charged him, Anderson adjusted and dug it in, but he was waiting for it judging by how quickly he was able to pull the ball behind square

short and wide and Dilshan gets into the party. But there is a sweeper cover out there, Adam Milne, who does well as he slides to his right. Dilshan's cut was placed well, as he waited for it just enough to hit it past the point fielder
tossed up on middle and off and it is defended away calmly
and it was only a matter of time until his sweep shot found the middle of the bat. This was on middle and off and he lofts it away over square leg and it goes for a one-bounce four
fifty for Dilshan with a calm push down the ground, almost characteristic of the innings he has played today. Dare I say, Dilshan has dropped anchor?
tossed up on middle and leg, and Sanga pushes it down the ground

oh, why would he do that when he was looking so good at the crease? chips it in the air straight to midwicket. Devcich gave the ball a little air and he came down the track, looking to clear the infield, but instead the flick shot found the fielder dead on. Wicket against the run of play for New Zealand but can they capitalise? Sanga looks absolutely bemused. I dont think even he understands how he could have perished like this

was that a chance? McCullum certainly thinks so and there was an edge, but it was far too thick for the keeper to collect it. Dilshan was looking to cut it fine to third man, but it kicks off the keeper's gloves and trickles away into the off side
short ball on leg stump and its pulled away to the man on the square boundary
tossed up on middle and he comes forward, keeping bat and pad together as he blocks
oh, he's beaten! Looking for more turn than that was present as he looking to drive the ball through the covers. McCullum has been doing that all day
goes for the reverse sweep to get himself out of trouble, but cannot connect as the ball is  on off stump, which was good for the shot, but it bounces a little more
this time he's off the mark as the fullish ball on leg stump is pushed to long-on
loud shout for leg before, Devcich is on his knees with such a prolonged appeal but the batsman is struck outside the line of off stump while playing a shot, the sweep.
nicely pitched up and he defends back to the bowler

oh, he's thrown it away! They're just checking for the no ball and it looks to be fine, the back part of the boot is behind the line. It was flighted on middle and off and Mahela made a foray down the track and lofted the ball straight up. He would have wanted to add a little more distance to it as long-off ran up and took an easy catch.
flatter ball on middle and leg and Dilshan stays stuck in the crease and pushes it back to the bowler
tossed up a lot more outside off stump and its driven to the covers
pushed through on the pads and he flicks it towards midwicket to take the single
goes off the inside half of the bat, which turns in his hand as he looks to drive on the up and down the ground. It was fullish and on midldle and goes off to mid-on
tucked away behind square leg as the ball was on a good length and the batsman are sprinting here. That is very good running and they turn a single into two
short and well directed, but it doesn;t have all that much pace with the older ball and Dilshan has enough time to pull it to deep square leg

slower ball bouncer and that could have spelled curtains for Mathews! he was into the shot far too early having been completely deceived. He gets a bottom edge and the ball is deflected onto his boot when it could easily have gone through his legs and onto his stumps
back of a length outside off stump and he blocks it away with soft hands
good start to a new spell as he keeps this outside off stump and makes the batsman block
almost a yorker-length ball on off stump and Dilshan digs it out off the front foot and into the covers
driven calmly to long-off as he flights the ball on off stump
holds that one just back a bit as Mathews comes forward and keeps it out
just a little flatter and he presents a straight bat again
a little flight and a hint of drift in too as the batsman is drawn forward and defends
chips down the track, reaches the pitch and just nudges it away straight to midwicket

gets hit somewhere around his stomach area. Too quick for Dilshan and there was a little inward movement too. He's been channeling that all day. He was looking to flick it away square on the leg side but to no avail
this was outrightly dug into the middle of the pitch, and as such he had a little more time to see it. He got back and pulls it away to deep square leg
on a length on off stump as he covers the line and clips it away square on the leg side to get off the mark

oh, lovely shot! What wrist work there from Dilshan! It was short again and this time he meets the ball with great intent, staying solidly balanced on his back foot and pulling it down behind square on the leg side
darts into the batsman again off a good length as Dilshan looks to block it away, but only gets an inside edge and Mathews calls him through for the single
helps it off to long leg. It was shortish again and he swivels on his back foot and pulls it in the air down to the man on the boundary
tossed up on middle and off and he is driven off the front foot into the covers
another full length ball that is nicely flighted and Dilshan who was looking to go a little too hard on it with a cut shot, gets a little under edge

oh, poor work there from Nathan McCullum at short cover. He should have got down a lot sooner, but was just too lazy. Dilshan's push through the covers off the back foot gets two when it should have been none
on a good length and he goes back to push it back to the bowler
flighted outside off and he drives to the man at cover
flighted on off stump and Dilshan drives it down the ground to pick up a single and Devcich finishes at just over three-an-over
tossed up on leg stump and he calmly pushes it away into the on side off the front foot
wanted a single there, but he hadn't placed it well enough as the full length ball which turns into him is pushed straight to cover
flatter on middle stump and he goes back to tuck it away behind square leg

and there is that special delivery from McCullum. This is why he is persisting with the angle around the wicket to the right hander. Mathews was looking for more turn, but this was the straighter one and had him fishing outside off and is beaten

what a reply. Slapped straight over the bowlers's head with the turn. Lovely strike. It was tossed up and he takes full advantage of that and the best thing of that shot was he wanted to hit it straight
flatter ball on middle and leg and he flicks it away to square leg
flatter ball on leg stump and he's picked away through midwicket
cut in the air, but it was well wide of the man at point. Flatter and quicker  from Nicol again, but this time there was loads of room offered and Mathews pounced on it
gives it a little too much air this time as the ball is taken on the full and whipped away to midwicket
full and just a little wide of off stump as Dilshan drives it strongly, but straight to cover
skips down the track and pushes the full length ball into the off side infield
shorter and flatter and he goes back to cut the ball to sweeper cover and that will be drinks
pitched up on leg stump, swept by Dilshan for one
tossed up on middle, the Mathews defends it back
short and outside leg, tucked to short fine leg
full on middle and leg, pushed to long-on
on length on middle going the other way, Mathews defends it on off with a thick outside edge
full on middle and leg, Mathews defends it back to the bowler
on length on the leg stump, tucked to deep fine leg
short of length on leg, tucked off the hips fine down the leg side for four! Very well placed by Mathews
on length outside off, Mathews defends towards cover
Mathews came down the pitch and the bowler banged it in short on leg, Mathews slapped it over his head to the wide long-on boundary for four
another one! Pitched outside off this time with some angle and Mathews drove it over the cover fielder to for four more
on length on middle, turned straight to midwicket
on length outside off, Dilshan drives to mid-off, can't time it properly
slower length delivery just outside off, pushed to cover
sways down leg this time and Dilshan works it to deep fine leg
another slower one on middle and leg, driven to deep midwicket
on length outside off, driven to deep point for another single
keeps it on length again outside off, driven off the back foot to cover, only three from the over
length bal angled in from outside off, pushed to cover
fullish delivery outside off and Dilshan has scooped it taking his eyes off the ball over the 'keeper's head and gets four
this is wider outside off and Dilshan can't connect for the scoop this time
short of length outside off, steered to backward point
Anderson keeps it outside off, but Dilshan connects this time and he's scooped another one down on one knee right over the keeper's head for a one-bounce boundary
scoops it to the keeper this time. Anderson kept it short of good length, Dilshan scooped it and it went high up in the air to land right in the keeper's hands close to the stumps for an easy catch
full on middle and leg, driven down to long-on for one
back of length around off, tucked to square leg and Thirimanne is off the mark
slow ball, short of length outside off, Mathews slashes hard and gets a thick outside off between the keeper and short third man for four to bring up the 200
on length on the stumps, pushed to long-on with soft hands with the intention for a couple but they get only one
goes wide outside off for a wide as Thirimanne leaves
on length outside off, driven to point at the edge of the circle
length delivery outside off, driven down to mid-off
on length on off, defends it back to the bowler
gets a bit of room outside off, Mathews drives firmly to cover where the fielder dives to his left
clears the in-field this time. He made some room and drove the length ball in the air over the covers for a four
down the leg side for a wide now
full on off, pushed down to long-on for one
on length outside off, the batsman guides it to backward point for one
lots of room outside off and Mathews swings his arms to send it over the covers again for another boundary
full on middle, pushed down to the bowler

and he strikes! It was a bit slower through the air, he pitched it on length around middle and off, Thirimanne put his right leg forward to defend and the ball turned to take a leading edge after pitching and ballooned to McCullum's right for an easy catch
fullish outside off, defends to cover and is denied the single
full on middle and leg, Chandimal drives it just past mid-on who dives and can't stop. It was going all the way to the boundary but Munro did very well to dive to his left and saved one run
on length on middle, pushed back to the bowler
fuller on the stumps, driven down to long-on and Mathews keeps strike
full on off, Mathews makes room and drives it hard straight to mid-off
slow and short of length from the back of the hand on off, Mathews stays back and defends it back to the bowler
fuller on the stumps, Mathews drives again and it's gone straight to mid-off
short ball outside off, runs it down to third man
back of length and angling in after pitching outside off, the batsman defends off the back foot
back of length outside off, pushed to cover. Just a single from the over
sends it down the leg side for a wide
on length outside off, Mathews tries to run it to third man, but can't connect
on the stumps this time, pushed down to long-on
flighted and on length on off, Chandimal defends
flighted on the stumps, driven down to long-on for one
flighted on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
full on the stumps, driven to long-on for one
flat delivery on the leg side, tucked to square leg for one
full on leg, tucked to short fine leg
is a chance for a run-out! Mathews drove the full toss to mid-off and the fielder got a direct hit at the non-striker's but Mathews is in by a yard or two
flighted on leg, turned past for one
full on middle and off, comes down the track and drives to mid-off
full toss on leg, driven down to long-on and that's the fifty for him
angled down the leg side, hits him on the pads outside leg as he tried to whip it
short ball around off, Mathews stayed back and half-pulled it to the deep fine leg area for four. There's nobody in the deep there
short outside off, driven to sweeper cover for one
slightly back of length outside off, driven wide of point for one
short of length around off, Mathews pulls but doesn't time it properly as it goes to long-on for one
short and wide outside off, Chandimal cuts it firmly but can't clear point
low full toss on off, driven down to long-on
another full toss, this one outside off and Chandimal can't get it past cover
bowled'im! Angles it in from outside off, he rolled his fingers across the ball and Chandimal was deceived by the pace as he tried to slog it on the leg side and missed it completely
outside off, pushed straight to point
short and wide, he gets enough room to cut it from the middle wide of point for four

angled in towards leg, Kula wants to glance it fine down the leg side for another boundary and he does, but it's off the pad. They'll take it whichever way. McClenaghan appealed but it was going down leg
on length around off and Mathews turns it on the leg side with soft hands for two quick runs
short and wide, he cuts and finds the point fielder again. Third man is in the circle
slower ball is pitched up on leg, turned to backward square leg for a quick one. Direct hit and Kulasekara was gone
slower ball again, it's a full toss this time outside off and Kula launches it over the cover fielder wide of long-off for four
full on off, driven down over the bowler's head for one
slow ball again - waist-high full toss, Mathews pulls it to deep midwicket
full on leg, Mathews whips it to the deep midwicket boundary for two
full on middle and off, defends it wide of cover for one
slower ball angled into the stumps, leading edge goes towards cover for one
the batsman makes room and cuts it over point for one
in the block hole, Kulasekara drives it to cover for one
short of length on middle and leg, Mathews comes down the track to slog but gets an inside edge on the leg side for a quick couple
on length on the stumps, Kula makes room to slash it over cover and gets only one as long-off get there quickly
low full toss on leg, driven to cover for a single

Kulasekara holes out to long-on! The pressure was building as Mills was not offering any width. He pitched it on length coming into the stumps, Kulasekara slogged and it went high in the air to be taken by Nathan McCullum well inside the boundary at long-on
full on off, lofts it straight down the ground to long-on for one
played-on! It was a slower delivery as Mille rolled his fingers over the ball, it pitched on length and might have gone down leg but Malinga made room to slog and got an edge to disturb his stumps
slower one again, it's going down leg and Senanayake gets enough bat to beat the short fine leg fielder for a boundary
low full toss on middle, driven down to long-off
goes all the way! McClenaghan pitched it up on the stumps and Senanayake launched it over the deep midwicket boundary. Clears the fielder easily
whips it away for four. It was full again and Senanayake found the gap between long and deep midwicket for another boundary
MM strikes back! Pitched it right in the block hole on middle, Senanayake came across towards off to paddle it fine but missed and the ball dislodged the bails easily
pitches it short angled into the batsman who can't connect and they run a leg bye after it hit him around the waist
leading lucky edge goes for four! It was full outside off, Mathews made room and slashed and found a thick edge which went over short third man for four

inn2.comm: swings it in from length around middle and Devcich gets a leg bye down to fine leg
full an outside off, driven nicely past cover for two
on length outside off with hardly any swing, Latham lets it go
swings it into the batsman from middle and leg, another leg bye to fine leg as he tries to flick it
swings it too much down the leg side for a wide and Sanga doesn't collect despite getting a hand to it, two byes too
swinging into the pads from middle and leg and the appeal is turned down as it was going down leg

yorked! This one's not going down leg..it was right in the slot, an inswinging yorker heads to the bottom of the middle and leg stumps as Devcich tried to turn it on leg but missed. First wicket in the first over for NZ too
on length and angled away from outside off, Latham leaves
on length and closer to off, angled away again and Latham lets it go
aimed towards middle from length on leg, Latham defends it back to the bowler
good-length ball around off, pushed to point off the back foot
away-swinging length ball outside off, Latham stays back and leaves
heading towards off stump from length, Latham defends it on off and Kula begins with a maiden
away-swinging ball from length outside off, thick outside edge goes to third man
right in the block hole as it swings into Latham and hits him right on the toe, loud appeal for lbw but it's going down leg
almost in the block hole on middle, Latham pushes it to mid-off
on length on off, Latham stays on the back foot and defends it on off
attempted yorker is a ow full toss well outside off, driven wide of point to deep backward point for two
bang in the block hole on middle and leg and Latham gets his bat down on time to protect his stumps
lbw appeal for inswinging delivery from length outside off, Nicol came across and took a step down as it his him high on the pad too, not out says the umpire
full o the stumps, pushed to mid-on
on length outside off, leans forward and defends to cover
Nicol walks across again and misses it completely as the ball pitched outside off on length and held it's line. Nicol played for the inswing and almost got an outside edge
length delivery outside off, defends to cover
sways down the leg side for a wide and Sanga gets a hand but can't stop it
back of length outside off, pushed to mid-off off the back foot
bouncer from Malinga just outside off, Latham sways outside the line. That was the first one for the over
another in-swinging yorker, follows the bouncer this time and Latham gets his bat down on middle stump right on time
